Class w3c.thotlib.Attribute 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----w3c.thotlib.Attribute
public class Attribute
extends Object
Java Classe associated to an Attribute of an Element.

The Java class is just a wrapper around the actual Attribute data structure handled in the native code.

SearchBackward
SearchForward
SearchInTree

Attribute()
Dumb initialization, don't use it unless you know the internals.
Attribute(AttributeType)
Create a new Attribute in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Attribute object.
Attribute(Document, int)
Create a new Attribute in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Attribute object.
Attribute(long)
Initialize a new Attribute object for an existing Attribute existing in the native code data space.

Attach(Element)
Attach the attribute to an element.
get_attribute(int)
Only for native accesses.
get_attribute(long)
Only for native accesses.
GetAttribute(Element, int)
Returns the existing Attribute of a given type associated to an Element.
GetString()
Get the internal string value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support string value.

GetValue()
Get the internal integer value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support integer value.

Print()
Debugging function.
Remove(Element)
Remove the attribute from an element.

Search of an element handling a given attribute.

Only for native accesses.

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support integer value.

Set the internal string value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support string value.

Set the internal integer value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support integer value.

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support string value.

SearchForward 
 public static final int SearchForward
SearchInTree 
 public static final int SearchInTree
SearchBackward 
 public static final int SearchBackward

Attribute 
 public Attribute()
Dumb initialization, don't use it unless you know the internals.

Attribute 
 public Attribute(long value)
Initialize a new Attribute object for an existing Attribute existing in the native code data space.

Parameters:
value - the actual reference to the native attribute
Attribute 
 public Attribute(AttributeType atType)
Create a new Attribute in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Attribute object.

Parameters:
atType - the attribute type of the new attribute.
Attribute 
 public Attribute(Document doc,
                  int atNo)
Create a new Attribute in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Attribute object.

Parameters:
doc - the document to hold the new attribute
atNo - the attribute type number (w.r.t. the document SSchema)

SearchAttribute 
 public static Attribute SearchAttribute(Element el,
                                         int atNo,
                                         int scope)
Search of an element handling a given attribute.

The search starts with an element passed as the starting point and browse either the subtree of the whole tree (backward or forward).

Parameters:
el - an element of the document to search in
atNo - the attribute type number (w.r.t. the document SSchema)
scope - either SearchForward, SearchBackward or SearchInTree
GetAttribute 
 public static Attribute GetAttribute(Element el,
                                      int atNo)
Returns the existing Attribute of a given type associated to an Element.

Parameters:
el - the Element
atNo - the attribute type number (w.r.t. el SSchema) returns the Attibute object i found, null otherwise
Remove 
 public void Remove(Element el)
Remove the attribute from an element.

Parameters:
el - the Element
Attach 
 public void Attach(Element el)
Attach the attribute to an element.

Parameters:
el - the Element
GetValue 
 public long GetValue()
Get the internal integer value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support integer value. return the value hold by this attribute

GetString 
 public String GetString()
Get the internal string value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support string value. return the value hold by this attribute

SetValue 
 public void SetValue(String value)
Set the internal string value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support string value.

Parameters:
value - the new string value for the attribute
SetValue 
 public void SetValue(int value)
Set the internal integer value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support integer value.

Parameters:
value - the new string value for the attribute

 public void SetValue(Document doc,
                      int value)
Set the internal integer value associated to an attribute

The function may fail if this attribute doesn't support integer value.

Parameters:
doc - the Document holding the attribute
value - the new integer value for the attribute
